item.title: Beyond EDR: Why Your Cybersecurity Strategy Is Failing
item.description:
At my last job, I heard a phrase that stopped me in my tracks:

“Everything is fine. We have an EDR solution, and we’ve never had an incident.”

This statement sounded reassuring on the surface, but the reality was dangerously different.

The True Scope of Responsibility
#

As a support engineer, my role extends far beyond “fixing machines” or “blocking emails.” My core mission is to ensure the operational continuity of the entire organization. This means every workstation, server, peripheral, and application must function as a cohesive, well-oiled part of a larger system.

item.title: My First Month in a SOC: From CVEs to Real Threats
item.description:
My first month in the Security Operations Center (SOC) felt like drinking from a firehose. Between the blinking dashboards, the constant stream of alerts, and the alphabet soup of acronyms, it was a lot to take in. But then, a real-world threat popped up on my screen, and suddenly, the theory I had been learning snapped into sharp focus. It all started with a CVE.

What’s in a Name? The Reality of a CVE
#

Before working in a SOC, I knew what a CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) was—a unique ID for a known vulnerability. But it was just a number, an entry in a database. It wasn’t until I saw one in the wild that I truly understood its power.
